text.0: roused from their bosom is the dawns beloved the joyous priest most sapient purifier.
text.1: he gives a signal both to gods and mortals to gods oblations riches to the pious.
text.2: most wise is he who forcing doors of paṇis brought the bright sun to us who feedeth many.
text.3: the cheerful priest mens friend and homecompanion through still nights darkness he is made apparent.
text.4: wise neer deceived uncircumscribed refulgent our gracious guest a friend with good attendants.
text.5: shines forth with wondrous light before the mornings the young plants hath he entered child of waters.
text.6: seeking our gatherings he your jātavedas hath shone adorable through human ages.
text.7: who gleams refulgent with his lovely lustre the kine have waked to meet him when enkindled.
text.8: go on thy message to the gods and fail not o agni with their band who pray and worship.
text.9: bring all the gods that they may give us riches sarasvatī the maruts aśvins waters.
text.10: vasiṣṭha when enkindling thee o agni hath slain jarutha give us wealth in plenty.
text.11: sing praise in choral song o jātavedas ye gods preserve us evermore with blessings.
